Requirements: Students may be admitted unconditionally if they have a high school GPA of 2.25 or higher. Required documents for admission include a completed Application for Admission, a $35 Application Fee, and an official High School Transcript. UNA is test optional; ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission.
Program name: Associate of Science in Culinary Arts
Associate of Science in Hospitality and Events Management

Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama is a test-optional institution for students applying with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. For students who submit test scores, unconditional admission requires a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a minimum of 940 on the SAT, along with a minimum high school GPA of 2.50. Conditional admission is possible with a minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT or 860 on the SAT and a minimum high school GPA of 2.00.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting
Bachelor of Science in Applied Health Science

Requirements:
Unconditional admission to the University may be granted to first-time freshmen who are graduates of a regionally accredited high school and meet one of the following criteria:
1. A minimum 2.50 cumulative high school GPA.
2. A minimum 2.00 cumulative high school GPA AND a minimum 18 ACT composite score or a minimum 960 SAT total score.

All students must submit an official high school transcript. The transcript must include the final senior grades, graduation date, and diploma type. Students must have completed the required number of high school courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Biology

Requirements: Unconditional Admission may be granted to first-time freshman applicants who meet the following criteria: A minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or SAT equivalent of 960), A minimum of a 2.25 high school grade point average (GPA) on a 4.0 scale. First-time freshmen who have a 2.75 or higher high school GPA may be admitted to UNA without an ACT or SAT score.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biology

Requirements: Students with a 2.50 or higher high school grade point average (GPA) will be admitted without an ACT or SAT test score. Students with a 2.00-2.49 high school GPA must have a minimum 18 ACT or 960 SAT to be admitted. Students with a high school GPA below a 2.00 must submit a complete application for committee review.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Biology (Cellular & Molecular Biology Option)

Requirements: To apply for freshman admission, applicants must complete the online application, pay the $35 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. For students with a 3.0 GPA or higher, ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission. For students with a 2.99 GPA or lower, a minimum 18 ACT or 960 SAT score is required for regular admission.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Business Administration (Flex)

Requirements: Unconditional Admission may be granted to applicants who are high school graduates, have an official ACT or SAT score, and a minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA. Test-Optional Admission may be granted to students with a 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA. Required documents include: a completed application, a $35 application fee, an official high school transcript, and official ACT or SAT scores (unless applying for Test-Optional Admission).
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Chemistry

Requirements: Prospective students must complete the online application for undergraduate admission, pay the non-refundable $35 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama offers test-optional admission to students with a 2.50 or higher high school GPA. For students who do not meet the test-optional criteria, official ACT or SAT scores must be submitted.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Chemistry

Requirements: As there are no specific admission requirements listed for the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Cinematic Arts and Theatre program, the general freshman admission requirements for the university apply. According to the university's freshman requirements page, first-time freshmen are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission. Unconditional admission is granted to students with a 2.25 GPA. Required documents include an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional.
Program name: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Cinematic Arts and Theatre

Requirements: General undergraduate admission to the University of North Alabama is required. For unconditional admission, applicants must have a minimum of a 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum ACT composite score of 18 (or SAT equivalent of 940). For conditional admission, applicants must have a minimum of a 2.00 high school GPA and a minimum ACT composite score of 16 (or SAT equivalent of 860). A test-optional admission path is available for students with a 2.75 GPA or higher.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Arts

Requirements:
To apply, a student must submit a completed application for admission, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. UNA practices a test-optional admissions policy. This policy allows a student to be admitted without a test score with a 2.5 GPA. Students can submit test scores if they choose, and scores can still be used for scholarship and course placement purposes.

Unconditional Admission:
- Minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA and minimum 18 ACT or 940 SAT
- OR Minimum 2.5 cumulative high school GPA (test-optional)
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Communication Arts

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of North Alabama as a first-time freshman, a student must submit an application for admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama practices test-optional admission. ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission into the university but may be submitted for scholarship consideration and course placement. Unconditional Admission requires a minimum 2.25 high school GPA, while Conditional Admission requires a minimum 2.00 high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Computer Information Systems

Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of North Alabama as a first-time freshman, applicants must submit an application for admission and an official high school transcript. The submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional due to the university's test-optional admissions policy. For unconditional admission, students must have a regular high school diploma and either a minimum 2.25 high school GPA OR a minimum 2.00 high school GPA with a composite ACT score of 20 or an SAT combined score of 1020. For conditional admission, students must have a regular high school diploma and either a minimum 2.00 high school GPA OR a composite ACT score of 18 or an SAT combined score of 940.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

Requirements: Admission to the University of North Alabama is based on a holistic review of a student's application. Applicants must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25. Required documents include the application for undergraduate admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission to the university but are used for placement in English and mathematics courses and for awarding academic and competitive scholarships.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Criminal Justice

Requirements: For unconditional admission, freshman applicants must have a minimum 2.25 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale). An official high school transcript, GED, or home school transcript is required for admission.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice

Requirements: The minimum requirements for admission to the University as a first-time freshman are as follows: Submit an official high school transcript or GED score. Submit an official ACT or SAT score. (Beginning with the fall 2021 entering class, UNA is test-optional for students who have a 3.0 or higher high school GPA.)
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Culinary Arts Management

Requirements: General university admission requirements for freshmen include submission of an application, official high school transcript, and an official ACT or SAT score. For unconditional admission, a student must have a 2.25 GPA and a 16 ACT/880 SAT score. For students who have a GPA of 2.0-2.24, the ACT must be an 18/950 SAT. Additionally, to be admitted to the College of Business and Technology, an undergraduate student must have an overall GPA of 2.0 or higher. The student must have also completed MA 112 or a higher level mathematics course, EC 221, EC 222, AC 291, CIS 125, and QM 291 with a grade of C or better in each course and an average GPA of 2.0 in those courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Economics

Requirements: To apply, prospective students must submit an online Application for Admission, a $35 Application Fee, and an official High School Transcript. For the Engineering Technology program, official ACT and/or SAT scores are explicitly required. While the university offers test-optional admission for students with a 3.00 or higher GPA, this option is not available for Engineering Technology program consideration. Admission is granted based on a combination of high school GPA and test scores, such as a minimum 2.50 GPA with a 16 ACT or 860 SAT, or a minimum 2.25 GPA with an 18 ACT or 940 SAT.
Program name: Bachelor of Engineering

Requirements: The University of North Alabama offers unconditional and conditional admission. Unconditional Admission: A minimum composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT-ERW+M) and a minimum of 2.25 high school GPA. Conditional Admission: A minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT (or 880 on the SAT-ERW+M) and a minimum of 2.0 high school GPA. The University of North Alabama offers a test-optional admissions plan for freshman students with a minimum of 3.0 high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology

Requirements: To be considered for admission, students should submit an application for admission, official high school transcript, and official ACT or SAT scores. To be admitted unconditionally, applicants must have a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or SAT equivalent) AND a minimum 2.00 high school GPA. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for students with a 3.0 or higher cumulative high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in English

Requirements: First-time freshmen who have earned a high school diploma or GED may be admitted to the university unconditionally with one of the following: 1. A minimum composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT-ERW+M); or 2. A minimum 2.50 cumulative high school grade point average (GPA). Conditional admission may be granted to students who do not meet unconditional admission requirements with a minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT (or 880 on the SAT-ERW+M) and a minimum 2.0 cumulative high school grade point average.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in English

Requirements: Unconditional admission to the University may be granted to first-time freshmen who are graduates of a regionally accredited high school (or the equivalent) and meet the following criteria: At least a 2.25 high school GPA and a composite score of 18 or higher on the ACT (or 960 or higher on the SAT-I ERW+M). UNA is test-optional for students with a 2.50 or higher high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry

Requirements: The University of North Alabama has general admission requirements for undergraduate students. For regular admission, a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 and a minimum ACT composite of 18 or SAT of 940 (combined Evidence-Based Reading & Writing and Math) is required. However, the university offers a test-optional policy for students entering in the Spring, Summer, or Fall 2025 semesters. Students applying under the test-optional policy must have a 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry

Requirements: Unconditional Admission: To be unconditionally admitted, a first-time freshman must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 and a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or an equivalent score on the SAT (960). Conditional Admission: To be conditionally admitted, a first-time freshman must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.0 and a minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT or an equivalent score on the SAT (880). Test-Optional Admission: Test-optional admission is available for first-time freshmen with a high school GPA of 2.50 or higher. The Office of Admissions reserves the right to require an ACT/SAT score on a case-by-case basis. Test scores will be required for some academic scholarships, nursing and honors college admission.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Business Option)

Requirements: The University of North Alabama practices a test-optional admission policy for most freshman applicants. Applicants may qualify for Unconditional or Conditional Admission. Unconditional Admission: Verified high school GPA of 2.50 or higher and a composite score of 18 or higher on the ACT (or 960 or higher on the SAT), OR a verified high school GPA of 3.0 or higher (test optional). Conditional Admission: Verified high school GPA of 2.00-2.49 and a composite score of 16-17 on the ACT (or 880-950 on the SAT).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Business Option)

Requirements: Admission requirements are not specified for this program. General freshman admission to the university is based on high school GPA and may require standardized test scores. Unconditional admission may be granted to first-time freshmen who meet at least one of the following criteria: High school GPA of 2.50 or higher on a 4.00 scale AND an ACT composite score of 18 or higher (or SAT equivalent of 940); High school GPA of 2.00-2.49 AND an ACT composite score of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent of 1020). The University of North Alabama also offers test-optional admission to students with a 3.0 or higher high school grade point average (GPA).
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Technology Option)

Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit an online application, a $35 application fee, and an official high school transcript. For unconditional admission, a minimum high school GPA of 3.0 is required. For conditional admission, a minimum high school GPA of 2.0 is required. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for admissions purposes, and the submission of an ACT or SAT score is not required for a student to be considered for admission.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Technology Option)

Requirements: Students who have completed the general education requirements and have earned an overall GPA of 2.75 or above are eligible for admission into the Exercise Science Major. Students may apply for admission by completing an application form in the HPER Office.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science

Requirements: First-time freshmen who have earned a high school diploma (or the equivalent) and are under the age of 21, must submit the following: a completed application for admission, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. An official ACT or SAT score may be required, however, UNA offers test-optional admission for applicants with a 2.75 or higher high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Fashion Merchandising and Design

Requirements: To be admitted to the BBA degree program, a student must have: 1. completed at least 45 semester hours of coursework; 2. completed the following courses with a grade of C or better: EN 111, EN 112, MA 112 or MA 113 or MA 125, CIS 125, AC 291, AC 292, EC 251, and EC 252; and 3. achieved a GPA of at least 2.25 on all coursework attempted at UNA.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance
Bachelor of Science in Fitness Management

Requirements: To be considered for admission, students must submit: an official high school transcript or GED score, an official ACT or SAT score, and a non-refundable $35 application fee. The University of North Alabama has a test-optional admissions policy for students with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. For unconditional admission for those submitting scores, a minimum 2.25 high school GPA is required along with a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a minimum combined score of 960 on the SAT.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Foreign Languages
Bachelor of Arts in Geography

Requirements: For unconditional admission, first-time freshmen must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 AND a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a 970 on the SAT. For conditional admission, applicants may have a high school GPA of 2.0 and a composite score of 16 on the ACT or a 880 on the SAT. For students who apply test-optional, you must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.5.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Geography

Requirements: UNA has two paths for unconditional freshman admission: 1. A minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale) and a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or 960 on the SAT (evidenced-based reading/writing + math). 2. A minimum 2.5 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Health & Fitness

Requirements: To be considered for admission to UNA, you need to submit the following: Online Application for Admission, $35 Application Fee, Official High School Transcript, Official ACT or SAT Score.
Program name: Bachelor_of_Science in Health Promotion

Requirements: First-time freshmen must submit an application for admission, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. An official ACT or SAT score may be required. For unconditional admission, a student must have a high school diploma with a minimum GPA of 2.25 and at least an 18 composite on the ACT or a 960 on the SAT. The university offers a test-optional admission policy for students who have a 3.0 or higher high school grade point average.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Events Management

Requirements: Unconditional admission to the University may be granted to a first-time freshman who meets the following criteria: Has a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 or higher; and, Has a composite score of 18 or higher on the ACT (or 960 on the SAT, taken March 2016 or after). Students who have a GPA of 2.00-2.24 must have a composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT, taken March 2016 or after) for unconditional admission. Students who have a composite score of 16-17 on the ACT (or 880-950 on the SAT) must have a GPA of 2.50 or higher for unconditional admission. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for students through the fall 2025 entry term. High school graduates who have at least a 3.0 GPA but do not have an ACT or SAT score on file may be admitted.
Program name: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Interior Architecture and Design

Requirements:
ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS FOR FIRST-TIME FRESHMEN: Students who meet the criteria for regular admission must meet one of the following requirements:

A minimum 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT (960 SAT).
OR
A minimum 2.50 high school GPA and a minimum 16 ACT (880 SAT).
OR
A minimum 3.00 high school GPA.

UNA is currently Test Optional for admissions. Students must have a 2.5 GPA for admissions without a test score. Students who don't meet this requirement may still be considered for admissions with a test score.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies

Requirements: The University of North Alabama is test-optional for admission purposes. Applicants with a minimum 2.25 high school GPA may be admitted without an ACT or SAT score. Applicants may also qualify for traditional admission with a minimum 2.0 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT composite score or 960 SAT composite score.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies

Requirements:
The program catalog states that admission to the College of Business and Technology is open to all students admitted to the University. The University of North Alabama's freshman admission requirements are as follows:

UNA is a test optional institution, and ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission for students with a 2.5 GPA or higher.

Students with a 2.00-2.49 GPA must submit an official ACT/SAT score for admission review.

Admission Types:
- Unconditional Admission: Students with a 2.25 GPA and an 18 ACT or a 960 SAT are unconditionally admitted to UNA.
- Conditional Admission: Students with a 2.00 GPA and a 16-17 ACT or an 880-950 SAT are conditionally admitted to UNA.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Management (Accommodation and Service Industry Management Concentration)

Requirements: General freshman admission to the university requires a high school diploma or GED. Unconditional admission requires a minimum 2.00 high school GPA and a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or 960 on the SAT-I). A test-optional policy is available for students with a 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA. After admission to the university, students are admitted to the B.B.A. Degree Program upon successful completion of the following with a cumulative grade point average of 2.0 or higher: CIS 125, EC 251, EC 252, AC 291, AC 292, MA 112 or higher, EN 111, and EN 112.
Program name: Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Marketing (Digital Marketing Concentration)

Requirements: Admission to the University is granted to students who show promise of success in a university curriculum. Applicants must submit a completed application for admission and an official high school transcript. For unconditional admission, applicants must meet one of the following criteria: 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale) OR 20 or higher ACT composite score (or SAT equivalent).
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Occupational Health Science

Requirements:
Admission to the University of North Alabama is based on a review of the high school academic record. Standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission consideration for most students.

Unconditional Admission:
- High school diploma from a regionally accredited high school
- At least a 2.25 high school grade point average (GPA)
- At least 15 approved units of high school work

Conditional Admission:
- High school diploma from a regionally accredited high school
- At least a 2.00 high school grade point average (GPA)
- At least 15 approved units of high school work
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Occupational Health Science

Requirements: UNA has a test-optional admission policy for first-time freshmen. Regular admission requirements include graduation from a regionally accredited high school with a regular or advanced diploma, and at least a 2.25 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Physics (General Physics Option)

Requirements:
First-time freshmen who graduated high school less than three years prior to the start of their entry term are required to submit an official ACT or SAT score report. Additionally, first-time freshmen are required to submit an official high school transcript showing GPA and graduation date.

Unconditional Admission:
- High school GPA of 2.25 or higher; and
- Composite ACT score of 18 or higher (or SAT score of 940 or higher).

Conditional Admission:
- High school GPA of 2.00 or higher; and
- Composite ACT score of 16 or 17 (or SAT score of 860-930).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Physics (General Physics Option)

Requirements: To be considered for admission, first-time freshmen must submit an application for admission, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. UNA is currently Test-Optional for students who have a 3.0 or higher high school GPA. Students with a GPA below a 3.0 must submit test scores for admission consideration.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science

Requirements: The University of North Alabama is test-optional for admission. Applicants can be admitted via two pathways: 1) Traditional admissions with a minimum 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT composite or 960 SAT total score. 2) Test-optional admissions with a minimum 2.50 high school GPA. Required documents include the application for admission, application fee, and an official high school transcript.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Political Science

Requirements:
The University of North Alabama has a test-optional admission policy for first-time freshmen through Fall 2025. Applicants with a high school GPA of 2.5 or higher are not required to submit test scores. Applicants with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.49 must submit a test score.

Unconditional Admission:
Requires either a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or 960 on the SAT) with a minimum 2.00 high school GPA, OR a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 with six completed semesters. An official high school transcript is required.

Conditional Admission:
Requires a minimum high school GPA of 2.00 and a composite score of 16 or 17 on the ACT (or 880-950 on the SAT).
Program name: Bachelor_of_Arts in Psychology

Requirements:
Unconditional Admission: High school GPA of 2.25 or higher. A high school diploma with a minimum of 24 credits.
Conditional Admission: High school GPA of 2.00-2.24. A high school diploma with a minimum of 24 credits.
UNA is test-optional for students with a high school GPA of 2.50 or higher. Students with a GPA between 2.0 and 2.49 will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis. Students with a GPA below 2.0 may be admissible with an ACT score of 18 or higher or a SAT score of 940 or higher.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Psychology

Requirements:
First-time freshmen must submit an official high school transcript. Applicants who graduated from high school within the last three years have two admission pathways:
1) Traditional Admission: Submit an official high school transcript and an ACT/SAT score.
2) Test Optional Admission: Students with a 3.00 high school GPA or higher who do not wish to have their test scores considered must complete the essay portion of the admissions application.

Unconditional admission requires a minimum 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT or 940 SAT score.
Conditional admission requires a minimum 2.00 high school GPA and a minimum 16 ACT or 860 SAT score.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Recreation

Requirements: Admission to the BSW Program is a selective process and must occur prior to a student's enrollment in any 400-level social work course. Students who meet the minimum criteria are not guaranteed admission to the program. The social work program admission criteria include: 1. Submission of a formal, written application to the BSW Program. 2. Completion of SW 230 and SW 235 with a grade of 'C' or higher. 3. Completion of at least 45 credit hours. 4. A cumulative GPA of at least 2.5. 5. Recommendation for admission by the Social Work Admissions Committee based on consideration of the completed application portfolio, which includes the formal application, the student’s academic record, a personal statement, and letters of recommendation.
Program name: Bachelor of Social Work

Requirements: The University of North Alabama practices a test-optional admission policy. Freshman applicants who have a 2.25 cumulative high school GPA or greater on a 4.0 scale will be granted unconditional admission. Applicants who have a cumulative high school GPA between a 2.0-2.24 on a 4.0 scale will be granted conditional admission. For students who choose to submit test scores, an 18 ACT composite or 960 SAT total score is required in addition to the GPA requirement.
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Sociology (Family Life Education)

Requirements: Unconditional Admission of First-Time Freshmen: Applicants who have a high school diploma or GED and meet the following criteria will be admitted unconditionally: 1. A minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or 940 on the SAT) and a minimum of a 2.0 high school GPA. OR 2. As a test-optional university, students with a minimum of a 2.25 GPA are not required to submit ACT/SAT scores.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Sociology (Family Life Education)

Requirements: UNA has a test-optional admission policy. Freshman applicants for admission must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25. Students must meet at least one of the following criteria for unconditional admission to UNA: High school GPA of 2.50 or higher and an ACT composite score of 18 or higher (or SAT equivalent). OR High school GPA of 2.75 or higher. OR High school GPA of 2.25 or higher and an ACT composite score of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Sport and Recreation Management

Requirements:
Admission to the University of North Alabama is based on a comprehensive review of each applicant's academic record. UNA practices test optional admissions. ACT/SAT scores will not be required for admissions consideration, scholarship review or for course placement. Students may choose to submit their test score as part of the admissions process. Students who meet the following criteria will be admitted to the university:

Unconditional Admission (With Test Score):
- Minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA on a 4.0 scale AND
- Minimum 18 ACT composite score or 940 SAT total score

Unconditional Admission (Without Test Score - Test Optional):
- Minimum 2.25 cumulative high school GPA on a 4.0 scale
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Sustainability
Bachelor of Science in Sustainability

Requirements:
To be admitted to the university as a freshman, applicants must submit an application, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama has a test-optional admission policy for students with a 2.25 or higher high school GPA.

Specific to the B.F.A. program: Admission into the B.F.A. program requires submission and approval of a portfolio of the student’s work during the student’s sophomore year after completion of the Art and Design Foundation courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Visual Arts and Design

Requirements: To apply for freshman admission, prospective students must submit an application for admission, pay the $35 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama is test-optional through Fall 2025, and standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission. For students who submit scores, unconditional admission may be granted with a minimum 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT composite (970 SAT ERW + M), or a minimum 2.50 high school GPA and a minimum 16 ACT composite (880 SAT ERW + M).
Program name: Bachelor of Arts in Visual Arts and Design

Requirements: The University of North Alabama has adopted a test-optional admission policy for first-time freshmen. Students may be admitted based on the traditional method or the test-optional method. For traditional admission, a student must have a minimum 2.0 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT or 960 SAT composite score. For test-optional admission, a student must have a minimum 2.5 high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Visual Arts and Design

Requirements:
Initial admission to the University of North Alabama for first-time freshmen requires an online application, a $35 application fee, and an official high school transcript. The university has a test-optional admission policy for students with a 2.25 or higher high school GPA. Students with a high school GPA between 2.00-2.24 must submit an official ACT or SAT score. For automatic admission, students must have a 2.00 high school GPA and an 18 ACT or 940 SAT.

After being admitted to the university and completing required coursework, students must apply for admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP). TEP admission requirements include: completion of 48 semester hours of coursework, a minimum overall GPA of 2.75 for unconditional admission (2.50-2.74 for conditional), successful completion of the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators tests (Reading 156, Writing 162, Mathematics 150) OR an ACT composite score of 21 or higher, a cleared Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE) background check, proof of liability insurance, a passing score on the TEP interview, and completion of the TEP application.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Biology (Secondary Education)

Requirements: Students applying for admission must submit an application for admission and an official high school transcript. For Unconditional Admission, students may be admitted with a 2.25 or higher high school GPA; UNA is Test-Optional for students applying for admission with at least a 2.25 high school GPA. For Conditional Admission, students with a 2.00-2.24 high school GPA and a 16 ACT composite or 880 SAT total (ERW+M) may be admitted.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Business Marketing (Secondary Education)

Requirements: First-time freshmen who have not previously enrolled at a college or university must submit an application for admission, a $35 application fee, and an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama is a test-optional institution, and freshmen applicants are not required to submit an ACT/SAT score for admission consideration.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Chemistry (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is a separate process from admission to the University. TEP admission is required before a candidate can enroll in any upper-level (300 or 400) professional studies courses. Requirements for Admission to the Teacher Education Program are:
- A grade of C or better in EN 111, EN 112, COM 201, and in all professional studies and teaching field courses.
- An overall 2.75 GPA (including transfer work), a 2.75 GPA in the area of professional studies, and a 2.75 GPA in the teaching field.
- Completion of a background check through the State of Alabama.
- Proof of professional liability insurance.
- A passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Collaborative Teacher (K-6)

Requirements:
To be eligible for admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP), the candidate must have: 
1. A minimum of 48 semester hours earned at a regionally accredited institution, including all required general studies and teaching field courses appropriate for the first four semesters of the chosen program of study. At least one semester must have been completed at UNA. 
2. Completed with a grade of C or better in the appropriate introductory professional education course sequence: ED 299, ED 381, EED 361, or EED 371; EN 111, EN 112; COM 201; MA 110, or a higher-level mathematics course; and at least one science course from biology, chemistry, earth science, or physics. 
3. Earned an overall GPA of 2.75 on all coursework attempted at all institutions attended. 
4. Earned a passing score on all parts of the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP), or received an ACT score of 22 or higher on the English, Reading, and Math sections of the ACT with a Composite score of 24 or higher on one test administration, or received an SAT score of 1190 or higher with a score of 550 or higher on the Evidence-Based Reading and Writing and a score of 550 or higher on Math on one test administration. 
5. Completed a successful background check in accordance with requirements of the Alabama State Department of Education.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Early Childhood Education (P-3)

Requirements: General freshman admission to the university is test-optional for students with a 2.75 or higher high school GPA. For those submitting scores, unconditional admission requires a minimum 2.50 GPA and 18 ACT or 960 SAT score. Conditional admission requires a minimum 2.00 GPA and 16 ACT or 880 SAT score. After admission to the university, students must apply for admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP). TEP requirements include: an overall GPA of 2.75 on a minimum of 48 semester hours, completion of specific general education courses with a 'C' or higher, a passing score on the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators Tests, a passing score on the departmental writing assessment, and a clear background check.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Elementary Education (K-6)

Requirements: Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is prerequisite to enrollment in all professional studies courses other than ED 299, ED 381, ED 381W, and EDU 300W. Requirements for unconditional admission to TEP are: 1. Completion of ED 299, ED 381/381W, and EDU 300W with grades of C or better. 2. Minimum overall grade point average of 2.75. 3. Passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP). 4. Completion of a background clearance according to requirements of the Alabama State Department of Education. 5. Approval of the TEP admissions committee.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in English Language Arts (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is required. To be eligible for admission to the TEP, a candidate must meet the following requirements:
1. Successfully complete a minimum of 48 semester hours of coursework.
2. Earn a minimum grade of C in EH 101, EH 102, COM 201, and all professional studies and teaching field courses attempted.
3. Successfully complete ED 299 or ED 299W.
4. Possess a minimum overall grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 on all coursework attempted at all institutions.
5. Successfully complete and pass the background check process through the ALSDE approved vendor.
6. Possess a valid ALSDE-issued Substitute Teacher License.
7. Provide evidence of professional liability insurance.
8. Complete an application for admission to the TEP.
9. Qualify for admission based on one of the following options: Pass all subtests of the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators test (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics); OR Have an ACT composite score of 21 or higher; OR Have a bachelor's or higher degree from a regionally accredited institution.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Family and Consumer Sciences (Secondary Education)

Requirements: Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is a prerequisite to enrollment in any professional studies courses beyond the 300 level. Formal application for admission to the TEP is made as a part of EL 310W. Requirements for unconditional admission to TEP include: 1. A minimum 2.75 GPA overall, in teaching field, and in professional studies on a 4.0 scale on all work attempted at UNA and at other institutions; 2. A passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP), prescribed by the Alabama State Board of Education; 3. Must clear a state and federal fingerprint background check. Note: Suitability is determined by the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE). Any infractions must be cleared by the ALSDE prior to admission to the TEP; 4. Must purchase and maintain liability insurance throughout the clinical practice portions of the program; and 5. Successful completion of EL 310W with a grade of C or better.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in French (Secondary Education)

Requirements: Initial admission to the university is test-optional for students with a high school GPA of 2.0 or higher. Specific to this degree, students must apply and be admitted to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) after completing at least 48 semester hours of coursework. TEP admission requires a minimum GPA of 2.75 (overall, in teaching field, and professional studies), completion of prerequisite general education courses, a passing score on the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP) basic skills assessment (currently the Praxis® Core tests), a successful TEP interview, a clear background check, and proof of professional liability insurance.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in General Science (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the Teacher Education Program is required. Requirements for admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) are:
1. Completion of an application for admission to the TEP.
2. Completion of a minimum of 48 semester hours of coursework.
3. A grade point average of at least 2.75 on a 4.00 scale on all coursework attempted (overall), in professional studies, and in the teaching field(s).
4. Completion of EN 111, EN 112, COM 201, and the General Studies math course required for the major with a grade of C or better in each.
5. Completion of ED 299 or EED 299 with a grade of C or better.
6. A passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP) as required by the Alabama State Department of Education.
7. A satisfactory background check as required by the Alabama State Department of Education.
8. Proof of professional liability insurance.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in General Social Science (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is required for enrollment in all upper-level professional studies courses. The requirements for admission to TEP are:
1. Completion of 48 semester hours of coursework.
2. Minimum overall grade point average (GPA) of 2.75 on all coursework attempted.
3. Completion of EN 111, EN 112, COM 201, and the general education mathematics requirement(s) for the student's major with a grade of C or better.
4. Background clearance through the ALSDE.
5. Proof of professional liability insurance.
6. A passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP). An ACT composite score of 21 or higher may be used to meet the basic skills assessment requirement.
7. Completion of TEP application.
8. A successful interview with the TEP Admissions Committee.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Geography (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) requires the following:

1. Completion of a minimum of 48 semester hours of coursework.
2. A minimum overall grade point average of 2.75 on all coursework OR a 3.0 on the last 32 semester hours attempted at UNA.
3. A minimum composite score of 21 on the ACT (or 1060 SAT) OR passing scores on all three sections of the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators Tests (Core) in Reading (156), Writing (162) and Mathematics (150).
4. Completion of EN 111, EN 112, COM 201, a literature sequence, a history sequence, and the general education mathematics requirement with a grade of C or higher in each course.
5. Satisfactory completion of an interview with a committee of at least three members of the College of Education and Human Sciences faculty who hold teaching certificates.
6. Satisfactory results of a background check in accordance with Alabama Code 2002, Title 16, Chapter 22A, Section 6.
7. Proof of liability insurance.
8. An approved application to TEP on file in the Office of Student Success and Certification.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in German (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
All secondary education programs require admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP). TEP admission requirements include:
1. An application for admission to the TEP submitted through the Tk20 system.
2. A minimum overall GPA of 2.75 on all work attempted at UNA and on all work attempted at other institutions.
3. Successful completion of EN 111, EN 112, COM 201, a general studies history, and a general studies mathematics course, all of which must be applicable to the student’s program of study.
4. A grade of C or better in EN 111, EN 112, and COM 201.
5. Successful completion of ED 299 or ECE 210 with a grade of C or better.
6. A qualifying score on the basic skills component of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP). Options include a) ACT: A composite score of 20 with a 20 or higher on the English subject area test and a 20 or higher on the mathematics subject area test; b) SAT: A score of 1030 on the mathematics and critical reading sections with a score of 500 or higher on both the mathematics and critical reading sections; or c) Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators tests: Reading 156, Writing 162, and Mathematics 150.
7. A satisfactory background clearance based on the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE) background check requirements.
8. Evidence of professional dispositions as evaluated by faculty and cooperating teachers in ED 299 or ECE 210.
9. Successful completion of an admission interview.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in History (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
To be eligible for unconditional admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP), which is a requirement for this degree, a candidate must: 
1. Have an overall GPA of at least 2.75 on a 4.0 scale for unconditional admission or a GPA of 2.50-2.74 on a 4.0 scale for conditional admission. The GPA is calculated on all coursework taken at all institutions.
2. Complete at least 48 semester hours of coursework.
3. Complete EN 111, EN 112, and COM 201 with a grade of C or better.
4. Complete the General Studies mathematics requirement with a grade of C or better.
5. Complete ED 299 or EED 299 or SE 299 with a grade of C or better.
6. Receive a passing score on the Basic Skills Assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP). Effective September 1, 2017, candidates must provide documentation of passing scores on the ACT® Reading (22), English (22), and Mathematics (22) subtests.
7. Provide documentation of a clear background check through the designated background check agency for the College of Education and Human Sciences.
8. Provide evidence of liability insurance from the student chapter of the Alabama Education Association (AEA) or other approved source.
9. Complete an application for admission to TEP.
10. Receive a favorable recommendation from the TEP Admissions Committee.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Mathematics (Secondary Education)
Bachelor of Science in Education in Music-Choral (P-12) (Secondary Education)

Requirements: Admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP) is prerequisite for all Professional Studies courses except ED 380. Requirements for admission to the TEP include: an application for admission; completion of a minimum of 48 semester hours of credit; a minimum GPA of 2.75 on a 4.00 scale in all courses attempted at all institutions; a minimum grade of C in all courses in the teaching field, required support courses, and professional studies; completion of EN 111, EN 112, COM 201 with a grade of C or better; completion of ED 380 with a grade of C or better; a satisfactory background check; and a passing score on the basic skills assessment of the Alabama Educator Certification Assessment Program (AECAP). The AECAP requirement can be met with a qualifying ACT score or by passing the Core Academic Skills for Educators test (Praxis Core).
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Music-Instrumental (P-12) (Secondary Education)
Bachelor of Science in Education in Physical Education (P-12) (Secondary Education)

Requirements: The University of North Alabama has a test-optional admission policy. Applicants may submit ACT/SAT scores or choose not to. For Regular Admission with test scores, a minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT composite or 940 SAT total is required. For Test-Optional Admission, a minimum 2.25 cumulative high school GPA is required, and applications undergo a holistic review. Factors for test-optional admission include high school GPA, courses taken in high school, and other supporting documents which could include a personal essay, resume, and/or letters of recommendation.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Physics (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Students may be eligible for unconditional admission with a 2.0 or higher high school GPA and a 18 or higher ACT composite score (940 SAT).

UNA requires the following for an unconditional admission decision:
1. Completed application for admission.
2. Official high school transcript with at least six completed semesters. GPA will be recalculated on a 4.0 scale on all academic coursework.
3. Official ACT or SAT score.

Students who do not meet unconditional admission requirements will be reviewed for conditional admission. Test-optional admission is available for students with a 2.50 or higher high school GPA.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Spanish (Secondary Education)

Requirements:
Admission to the University of North Alabama does not include admission to the Teacher Education Program (TEP). Candidates seeking certification must meet the following requirements to be admitted to the TEP.
1. A minimum of 48 semester hours of credit earned.
2. A minimum grade point average of 2.75 on a 4.00 scale for all coursework attempted and in each of the following areas: teaching field, professional studies and overall.
3. A qualifying score on the basic skills component of the state prescribed test (ACT score of 20 or higher on the English, Reading, and Math sections; or passing scores on all three sections of the Praxis Core Academic Skills for Educators test). Scores must be on file in the Certification Office (501 Willsingham Hall) prior to admission to TEP. For current passing scores for the Praxis Core tests, visit the Alabama State Department of Education website.
4. Successful completion of an interview with a minimum of two full-time faculty from the College of Education and Human Sciences.
5. Successful completion of the following courses with a grade of C or better: ED 299; and EED 361W or SED 372W; and COM 201; and EN 111 and EN 112; and MA 110 or higher.
6. Proof of professional liability insurance. The student membership in the Alabama Education Association includes the required insurance. This insurance must be kept current throughout the program.
7. A clear background check based on an official criminal history background check through the Alabama State Department of Education (ALSDE).
8. A grade of C or better in all professional studies and teaching field courses.
Program name: Bachelor of Science in Education in Visual Arts (P-12) (Secondary Education)
